agreement.title: Welcome to UBCupids! üèπ
agreement.description: Before you begin, here's what you're signing up for:
points: Your responses are private and encrypted for your security
You can rank importance for personality and preference questions (basic info and open-ended questions don't have importance ratings)
You'll be matched with 1-3 people based on compatibility
Questionnaires close on January 31st. Be sure to submit before then! Matches will be revealed on February 7th, 2026
commitments: Respond to my match(es) within 48 hours
Have at least one genuine conversation (even if brief)
Be respectful, whether or not there's a romantic connection
agreement.reminder: Remember: Real people are hoping to meet someone like you. Even if there's no spark, kindness goes a long way.
agreement.agreementText: I understand and agree to participate thoughtfully

sections.title: Basic Info & Matching Criteria
sections.description: This helps us understand who you are and who you're looking for.

questions.text: What's your gender identity?
What's your sexual/romantic orientation?
I'm open to being matched with: (select all that apply)
questions.note: Your matches will only include people whose preferences are compatible with yours.

sections.title: Icebreakers / Personality
sections.description: Let's get to know you! These questions help us understand your personality and sense of humor.

questions.text: At a party where you don't know anyone except the host, you:

options.label: Confidently introduce yourself to new people
Stick near the host until you warm up
Leave early and text an apology later
I wouldn't go to this party in the first place

questions.text: Your ideal Saturday morning is closest to:
questions.rationale: Energy level, social vs. solo, routine vs. spontaneity

options.label: Up at 7am for a run, hike, or gym session
Catching up on work, hobbies, or side projects

questions.text: You've had a terrible day. What helps you decompress?

options.label: Diving into a show, book, or game

questions.text: If you were to make plans with friends, you're the person who:

options.label: Goes with the flow (whatever everyone else wants)
Suggests ideas but lets someone else finalize
Shows up when told where to go
Honestly, I'm terrible at committing to plans

questions.text: Your texting style is best described as:

options.label: I respond when I can, but might take a few hours
Terrible‚ÄîI forget to reply for days

questions.text: Which type of humor makes you laugh the most? Pick the example that would actually make you chuckle:

options.label: Clever wordplay or puns ‚Äî "I'm reading a book on anti-gravity. It's impossible to put down."
Absurd or random humor ‚Äî "What if soy milk is just regular milk introducing itself in Spanish?"
Dark or edgy jokes ‚Äî "I have a joke about trickle-down economics, but 99% of you will never get it."
Wholesome or goofy humor ‚Äî "Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!"
Sarcastic or dry humor ‚Äî "I'd agree with you, but then we'd both be wrong."
Self-deprecating humor ‚Äî "I'm not saying I'm bad at multitasking, but I can't even fail at two things at once."
Actually, what I find funny is: _____ (self describe)

questions.text: Your relationship with spontaneity:

options.label: I thrive on it‚Äîlet's do something random right now
I like it occasionally, but prefer some structure
I need advance notice for most things

sections.title: What I'm Like
sections.description: Tell us more about yourself‚Äîyour lifestyle, values, and how you navigate the world.

questions.text: My dating experience is:

options.label: I've tried but got rejected every time
I've never had or pursued a romantic relationship before
I've dated multiple times so far
I'm VERY experienced with dating (why exactly are you here? ü§®)

questions.text: I'd describe my energy level as:

options.label: Moderate‚ÄîI have bursts of energy and downtime

questions.text: My ideal work-life balance looks like:

options.label: Career-focused, but I make time for loved ones
Balanced, work and personal life are equally important
Life comes first, work is just to pay the bills

questions.text: When I'm stressed or upset, I typically:

options.label: Want to talk it out immediately
Need space first, then I'll open up
Distract myself until I feel better

questions.text: Personal growth and self-improvement are:

options.label: Important, but it's not my whole identity
Not really a priority for me right now
I'm not sure what this means to me

questions.text: I'd describe my social battery as:

options.label: Infinite, I could hang out with people all day
High, but I need occasional alone time to recharge
Moderate, I like socializing, but in smaller doses
Low, I'm selective about when and who I socialize with
I'm basically a hermit, and I'm fine with that

questions.text: My living space is usually:
When it comes to money, I tend to:

options.label: Save aggressively, I'm very financially cautious
Save regularly, but I also enjoy spending on select things I value
Live in the moment, I don't think much about saving

questions.text: I am most like...

options.label: It varies, I don't have a set rhythm

questions.text: My relationship with exercise:

options.label: It's a huge part of my routine (5+ times/week)
I'm active a few times a week

questions.text: How I handle conflict:

options.label: Give it some time to cool off, then talk it through
Process internally on my own first, I prefer to avoid confrontation when possible
I can get emotional in the moment and need space to collect myself

questions.text: If your partner gets attention from someone else (flirting, interest, etc.), how do you view feeling jealous in that situation?

options.label: It's healthy, being jealous shows that I care about my partner
A bit is normal, but too much is a problem
It's mostly a sign of my insecurity

questions.text: I'd describe my communication style as:

options.label: Indirect, I hint rather than state directly

questions.text: My relationship with alcohol:

options.label: I enjoy drinking socially (parties, bars, etc.)
I don't drink and prefer partners who don't either

questions.text: When it comes to trying new things, I'm:

options.label: Always down, I love novelty and adventure
Resistant, I like what I like

questions.text: Which statement resonates most with you?
How important is religion or spirituality in your life?

options.label: Not very important, but I respect it

questions.text: Rank your top 3 love languages (how you prefer to receive affection). You can do a love language quiz if you want: The [Official] Love Language¬Æ Quiz is a good one

options.label: Words of Affirmation (compliments, "I love you", verbal encouragement)
Acts of Service (doing helpful things, taking care of tasks)

questions.text: In a relationship, I would:

options.label: Open up quickly, I'm an open book
Take time to build trust before opening up
Keep things pretty private, even when close

questions.text: When someone I care about is going through a hard time, I typically:
questions.rationale: Emotional intelligence and support style. Mismatches here cause relationship friction (e.g., "fixer" paired with someone who just wants to be heard)

options.label: Jump in to help solve the problem
Give them space unless they ask for help
Try to distract them and cheer them up
I struggle with knowing what to do

sections.title: What I'm Looking For
sections.description: Help us understand what kind of partner and relationship you'd prefer.

questions.text: Right now, I'm looking for:

options.label: Dating with potential for something serious
Friendship first, see where it goes
Honestly, I'm just exploring and open to anything

questions.text: I'm looking for someone whose energy level is:

options.label: Similar to mine (what I answered in Q14)

questions.text: What is the acceptable age range for your match?
I'm looking for someone who is:

options.label: Somewhat social, but also enjoys alone time

questions.text: In terms of ambition, I want someone who:

options.label: Prioritizes relationships and experiences over career
Doesn't matter, as long as they're happy
Has similar ambition levels to me

questions.text: When I'm going through a hard time, I would like someone to:
questions.rationale: Emotional support needs, complements q32 on support style given

options.label: Give me space unless I ask for help
Distract me and cheer me up
Match what I do for others (from q32)

questions.text: Would you date someone who was significantly messier than you?

options.label: Absolutely not, I need someone who's clean
Probably not, it would bother me
I could deal with it if other things were great
Yes, I don't care about mess
I'm the messy one, so yes

questions.text: When it comes to humor, I want someone who:

options.label: Can joke around but also be serious
Doesn't need to be funny, just genuine

questions.text: I'm looking for someone who handles conflict by:

options.label: Doesn't matter, as long as we resolve it
Similar to how I handle it (from Q23)

questions.text: What love languages do you most naturally GIVE? Rank your top 3:
questions.rationale: Affection needs, compatibility with love languages

options.label: Words of Affirmation (compliments, "I love you", verbal encouragement)
Acts of Service (doing helpful things, taking care of tasks)

questions.text: I want someone who is:

options.label: Somewhat open, but private about some things
Doesn't matter, I meet people where they are

questions.text: In terms of lifestyle, I'm looking for someone who:

options.label: Enjoys some physical activity but isn't extreme
Doesn't matter‚Äîwe can find common ground

questions.text: I want someone who is:
Politically/socially, I'm looking for someone who:

options.label: Leans the same direction but doesn't have to match exactly
Doesn't matter‚Äîpolitics aren't a big factor for me

questions.text: I want someone whose relationship with alcohol is:

options.label: Less than mine (I'd prefer they drink less)
More than mine (I want someone more social)

questions.text: I'd prefer if someone:

options.label: Dated a few times through high school and university
Has a very experienced dating history

questions.text: In a relationship, communication is:

options.label: Constant, I like frequent check-ins and updates
Casual, we talk when something comes up
Independent, we mainly do our own things

questions.text: Imagine you're getting close to someone you like. What's your first instinct?

options.label: I feel comfortable and excited‚Äîit feels natural to get close
I feel excited, but I also get anxious about whether they feel the same
I enjoy them, but I want to keep some distance so things don't get too intense
I want closeness, but I also get scared and pull back
None of these fit me well

questions.text: For me, quality time means:

options.label: Just being in the same space

questions.text: I'd prefer someone who:

options.label: Is equally focused on personal growth
Values growth but doesn't need to be as intense about it
Doesn't need to prioritize growth, I accept them as they are

questions.text: I see arguments in a relationship as:

options.label: Necessary sometimes, but should be rare

questions.text: When it comes to personal space in a relationship:

options.label: I need a lot of independence and alone time
I like a balance of togetherness and space
I prefer spending most of my time together
I'm figuring out what I need

questions.text: To me, commitment in a relationship means:

options.label: Showing up consistently, even when it's hard
Prioritizing the relationship over other things
I'm still figuring out what commitment means to me

questions.text: How important is sexual intimacy in a relationship to you?
The most important thing in a relationship to me is:
What relationship pace feels most comfortable to you?

options.label: Prefer to take things slowly, emotional connection first
Comfortable with physical intimacy early on

questions.text: My ideal distance for a relationship:

options.label: Same campus / very close by (walking distance)
Willing to do long-distance if the connection is there

sections.title: Open-Ended Text
sections.description: Share more about yourself in your own words. These help us understand your personality and give your matches conversation starters.

questions.text: Something I absolutely cannot compromise on in a relationship:
questions.rationale: Personal dealbreaker, gives human cupids context
questions.placeholder: Example: "Honesty‚ÄîI need complete transparency" or "Respect for my career ambitions"

questions.text: What's something you're passionate about that people might not know?
questions.placeholder: Example: "I'm weirdly into urban planning‚ÄîI'll spend hours redesigning transit systems in my head. My friends think it's boring, but I genuinely love it."

questions.text: If you were matched, what is one thing you want the other person to know about you?
questions.placeholder: Example: "I take a little time to open up, but I'm thoughtful, loyal, and genuinely invested once I do."

questions.text: Ask your match a question! Write one question you'd want your match to answer. This could be fun, deep, or anything in between.
aiGeneratorExamples: What's a belief you held strongly 5 years ago that you've completely changed your mind about?
If you could have dinner with anyone, living or dead, who and why?
What's something small that makes you unreasonably happy?
What's the most valuable lesson a past relationship taught you?
questions.placeholder: Example: "What's your biggest fear?" or "What's a belief you held strongly for a long time that you've completely changed your mind about?"
